intro: Galium anisophyllon, commonly known as the narrow-leaved bedstraw, is a flowering plant species belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, ascending stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy. The flowers are small, white or pale pink, and arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. This plant is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
